title: Graph of field between lines of charge

content.question: Two very large parallel plates have equal amounts of opposite charge, and both have uniform surface charge density. Cross sections of portions near the center of each plate are shown above. The positive plate is at <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> . Which of the following graphs correctly represents the magnitude of the electric field <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between the plates and the magnitude of the force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on a positive test charge between the plates as functions of the position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> along a line through the center of the plates?

choices.label: The figure presents two graphs. The first graph is in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled x and vertical axis labeled E. The line begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. The second graph is in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled x and vertical axis labeled F. The line begins on the vertical axis just above the origin and moves upwards and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents two graphs. The first is in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled x and vertical axis labeled E. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves downwards and to the right at a constant rate. The second graph is in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled x and vertical axis labeled F. The line begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right.

content.answer: The figure presents two graphs. The first is in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled x and vertical axis labeled E. The line begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
